content: As a Puzzle Creator, I have crafted a challenge that requires logical thinking and language skills. Consider the following phrase "An empty vessel..." and rearrange the words to create a grammatically correct sentence that conveys the message that having something is better than having nothing. Take your time and don't let the simplicity of the words fool you. The solution may surprise you!

Certainly! Let's rearrange the phrase "An empty vessel..." to create a sentence that conveys the message that having something is better than having nothing. Here's a possible rearrangement:

"An empty vessel is better than none."

This maintains the essence of the original phrase while delivering the intended message.
